column3: Shouldn't this just be thrown into the linux descriptor?\n
I think @luke-jr point make sense (if its technically possible), because it will still be a "armhf" linux build I guess?\nBut no strong opinion.\n
Agreed with @luke-jr. That descriptor was created to work with multiple archs. Either use a single descriptor for all, or break them all out.\n
Also, there should be no need for that linker script. Boost shouldn't be able to leak symbols because we use -Wl,--exclude-libs,ALL. Details on leaked symbols would be useful.\n
@theuni I agree, this should be rolled into -linux.yml\n
Did you try this? I don't think this will work. (c.f. #7465)\n

So curl is not needed here? 

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blame/87d65622996d6b6539dba973a4427e542cc291c7/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml#L9

It build just fine without it, but I'll add it for consistency.

```
b4747e18f8fdadddbe8f3337e7f1f3eebd471a4851ea50c3d7d889d38f960298  bitcoin-0.12.99-armhf-cli.tar.gz
ca5591a49e27ce1c5af4fb2cc4801392df2d39b79b5da96c4f393b56a8321f9d  src/bitcoin-0.12.99.tar.gz
48371b783f4347d7d16e138e61b292c678c77aa2e881d2dce060365efb5a70cd  bitcoin-linux-armhf-0.13-res.yml
```
If it is not needed, but needed in #7658, it should be _removed_ for consistency?\n
Maybe, but not as part of this PR.\n
